name: Arrabbiata Sauce
description: The classic Italian spicy arrabiata sauce, that's so easy to make!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes (or to taste)
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat, add the onion and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the tomatoes and simmer, until the sauce thickens, about 10 minutes, breaking the tomatoes apart with a wooden spoon or masher, as it cooks.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Mix in the basil and enjoy!

name: Korean Style Chili
description: A tender slow braised beef chili with spicy Korean gochujang!
ingredients: 4 slices bacon, cut into 1 inch slices)
2 pounds stew beef (such as chuck roast), cut into 1/2 inch cubes
instructions: Cook the bacon in a large saucepan before setting aside, reserving 1 tablespoon the grease in the pan.
Add the beef and cook in the bacon grease over medium-high heat until browned on all sides.
Add the onion and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic, paprika, cumin, and coriander and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Add the beef broth, coffee, tomatoes, gochujang, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, soy sauce, oregano, and bacon, mix, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until the beef is falling apart tender, about 2 hours.
Add the vinegar and season with salt to taste.

name: Mexican Style Bolognese
description: A Mexican inspired take on a bolognese sauce with smoky chipotle chili peppers!
ingredients: 4 strips bacon, cut into 1 inch pieces (optional)
instructions: Cook the bacon in a large saucepan and set aside, reserving 1 tablespoon of grease in the pan.
Add the beef, onion, green pepper and jalapeno and cook, breaking the beef apart as it cooks, before draining any excess grease.
Add the garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, cinnamon, and allspice, mix and cook until fragrant, about a minute.

Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, chipotle chilies, oregano, and bay leaves, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer. (Note: You can simmer for as little as 10 minutes, up to several hours, covered.)
Add the cheese and sour cream, mix and let the cheese melt into the sauce.
Add the vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste before mixing in the cilantro and enjoying!

name: Hibachi Chicken and Vegetables
description: Hibachi style sauteed chicken and vegetables with plenty of butter and garlic along with a splash of lemon juice!
ingredients: 1 pound chicken boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the chicken, onion, mushrooms, zucchin and cook, until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender, about 7-10 minutes.
Add the butter and let it melt before mixing in the garlic and cooking until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the soy sauce, lemon juice, sesame oil and sesame seeds and enjoy!

name: Hibachi Chicken Fried Rice
description: A hibachi style chicken fried rice with plenty of butter and garlic!
ingredients: 1/2 pound chicken, cut into small pieces
instructions: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the chicken and onion and cook, until the chicken is cooked through and the onion is tender, about 7-10 minutes.
Add the butter and let it melt before adding the garlic and cooking until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the rice and soy sauce and mix well.
Form a large opening in the middle of the pan, add the eggs and cook, scrambling a bit before mixing into the rice.
Mix the peas and carrots in and warm.
Mix the vinegar, sesame oil, sesame seeds and green onions in and enjoy!

name: Hibachi Mustard Sauce
description: A creamy spicy mustard sauce with hints of sesame and maple! This mustard sauce is inspired by a sauce commonly found in American Japanese style hibachi restaurants, such as Benihana. The main ingredients is spicy
instructions: Puree everything in a blender or food processor and enjoy!

name: Hibachi Ginger Sauce
description: A fresh ginger sauce with onion, lemon, soy sauce and a hint of maple!
instructions: Puree everything in a blender or food processor and enjoy!

name: Yum Yum Sauce
description: A super tasty hibachi style seasoned mayonnaise sauce!
instructions: Mix everything well and enjoy!

name: Hot Cheesy Sausage Dip
description: A hot melted cheese dip with plenty of spicy chorizo sausage, tomato and jalapenos! Perfect for dipping or pouring over nachos!
ingredients: 1/2 pound fresh chorizo sausage, casings removed
1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes (I like fire roasted)
instructions: Cook the sausage and onion in a skillet until cooked through, breaking it apart as it cooks.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute, before setting aside.
Melt the butter in a pan over medium heat and cook until it foams and turns lightly golden brown.
Sprinkle in the flour and cook, stirring, until lightly golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.
Add the milk and cook, stirring, until the sauce thickens, about 3 minutes.
Add the cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese and cream cheese, and cook until it melts into the sauce.*
Add the chorizo, diced tomatoes and jalapenos and warm before enjoying!

name: BBQ Pulled Pork Nachos
description: BBQ pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw in nacho form with plenty of melted cheese!
ingredients: 2 cups cheese (such as cheddar and/or monterey jack), shredded
instructions: Spread the tortilla chips out on a baking sheet in a single layer, top with the pork, onion, jalapenos and cheese and bake in a preheated 350F/180C oven until the cheese has melted, about 5-10 minutes.
Drizzle the BBQ sauce over the nachos before sprinkling on the coleslaw and cilantro and enjoy!

name: 20 Minute Light Lemon Chicken
description: A quick and easy, light and healthy Chinese style lemon chicken that's just packed with flavour!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan over medium-high heat, add the chicken and cook until cooked through, about 2-4 minutes per side.
Add the mixture of the chicken broth, lemon juice, lemon zest, honey, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes and corn starch, to the pan and cook until the sauce thickens, about a minute.
Add green onions and enjoy!

name: Ropa Vieja (aka Cuban Style Shredded Beef)
description: Slowly braised beef in a tasty Cuban style sauce with onions, peppers, garlic, olives and capers!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar (or lime juice)
instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the beef and brown on all sides before setting aside.
Add the onion, and bell peppers to the pan and cook until tender, about 7-10 minutes. (Add more olive oil if needed.)
Add the garlic, tomato paste, cumin, paprika, allspice, and cloves, and cook until fragrant, about a minute, mixing it in as it cooks.
Add the beef broth, crushed tomatoes, oregano, and bay leaves, and mix before adding the beef.
Bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until the beef is falling apart tender, about 2 hours.
Remove the beef from the pot, shredd and mix back in, along with the olives and capers and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste before mixing in the cilantro and enjoying!

name: Jalapeno Popper Sloppy Joes
description: Jalapeno popper flavoured sloppy joes filled with cheddar cheese, cream cheese and jalapenos! Yum!
ingredients: 6 strips bacon, cut into 1/2 inch pieces (optional)
1 tablespoon steak seasoning (or salt and pepper to taste)
instructions: Cook the bacon in a skillet before setting aside on paper towels and draining off the bacon grease from the pan.
Add the beef and onions to the pan, cook over medium-high heat, breaking the beef up as it cooks, and drain any excess grease from the pan.
Add the jalapeno and garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the ketchup, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, paprika, and steak seasoning and bring to a simmer.
Add the cheddar and cream cheese and let them melt into the sauce before mixing in the bacon.
Assemble the sandwiches and enjoy!

name: Chipotle Sweet Potato Soup
description: A smooth and creamy sweet potato soup with a hint of smoky chipotle chilies!
ingredients: 1 bell pepper (red, orange, yellow or green), diced
2 chipotle chilies in adobo sauce, chopped*
2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, add the onion and bell pepper and cook until tender, about 7-10 minutes.
Add the garlic, chipotle chilies in adobo sauce, cumin, and paprika and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the broth, sweet potatoes, diced tomatoes and oregano, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the sweet potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.
Puree some or all of the sweet potatoes in the soup before seasoning with lime juice, salt and pepper to taste.
Mix in the cilantro and enjoy!

name: Baked Tomato and Feta Pasta
description: A super simple baked feta and roasted tomato pasta that’s so nice and creamy and good!
ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced
instructions: Place the tomatoes and feta in a single layer in a baking dish, drizzle on the olive oil, and sprinkle on the oregano, thyme, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper to taste.
Bake in a preheated 400F/200C oven until the tomatoes are blistered and the feta is golden brown and soft on the inside, about 35 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta as directed on the package and drain, reserving some of the pasta water.
Add the garlic and basil to the pan with the tomatoes and feta and mix everything into a nice creamy sauce, before mixing in the pasta.
Optionally mix in some of the reserved pasta water to get the sauce to the desired level of sauciness and creaminess!

name: Lemon Ginger Turmeric Chicken and Rice Soup
description: A light, healthy and tasty chicken and rice soup with lemon, ginger, garlic, turmeric and cayenne!
ingredients: 1 cup jasmine rice (or other long grained rice)
1 pound boneless and skinless chicken thighs (or breasts)
instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the onion, celery and carrots and cook until tender, about 7-10 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, rosemary, thyme, turmeric, and cayenne, and cook, mixing, until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the broth, rice and chicken, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until the rice is just tender, about 20 minutes.
Remove the chicken, slice (or shred) and mix back into the soup.
Add the lemon juice and parsley, season with salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!

name: Bruschetta Chicken
description: Pan seared chicken served bruschetta style with a fresh tomato topping!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts (or thighs), butterflied or pounded thin
instructions: Season the chicken with the Italian seasoning, salt and pepper, to taste.
Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat, add the chicken and cook until golden brown on both sides, about 3-5 minutes per side, before removing from heat.
Mix tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, onion, basil, salt and pepper.
Serve the chicken topped with the tomato mixture.

name: 20 Minute Vietnamese Lemongrass Beef
description: A quick, easy and tasty Vietnamese style lemongrass beef!
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef (or pork or chicken)
2 teaspoons cumin seeds, toasted and ground
1 birds eye chili, thinly sliced (or chili sauce to taste)
instructions: Cook the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat until cooked through, breaking it apart as it cooks, before draining off any excess grease.
Add the lemongrass, shallot, garlic, galangal, cumin, turmeric, and birds eye chili, mix well and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the lime, fish sauce, and sugar, mix well, taste and adjust the seasoning to taste.*
Mix in the cilantro, mint, and basil, and enjoy!

name: Spinach and Artichoke Chicken Piccata
description: Chicken in a lemon, butter and caper sauce with spinach and artichokes!
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breasts (boneless and skinless), pounded thin or butterflied
1/4 cup dry white wine (or chicken broth)
1 cup artichoke hearts, sliced or coarsely chopped
instructions: Heat the oil and butter in a pan over medium-high heat, add the chicken and cook until lightly golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side, before setting aside.
Add the garlic and saute until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the wine and deglaze the pan by scraping any brown bits up off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon as it sizzles.
Add the broth, capers, artichoke hearts and chicken, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the sauce thickens a bit, about 3-5 minutes.
Add the baby spinach and butter and cook until the spinach wilts and the butter melts, about 2 minutes.
Add the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste, before mixing in the parsley and enjoying!

name: Mediterranean Baked Feta
description: Feta that's baked with olives, tomatoes, and oregano that 'melts' into crostini, crackers or chips that's dipped into!
ingredients: 1 cup cherry/grape tomatoes, sliced in half
instructions: Place the feta in a large baking pan.
Mix the olives, tomatoes, sundried tomatoes, garlic, oregano, thyme, salt and pepper and pour into the baking dish around the feta.
Drizzle the olive oil over everything.
Bake in a preheated 400F/200C oven for 20 minutes before turning on the broiler to broiling until the feta turns a light golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.

name: Roasted Potatoes in a Melted Goat Cheese Dressing
description: Warm roasted potatoes in a lemon dijon dressing with goat cheese that melts into the potatoes!
ingredients: 2 pounds potatoes, cleaned and cut into wedges
4 tablespoons goat cheese (chevre), crumbled, room temperature
2 tablespoons lemon juice (or apple cider vinegar)
instructions: For the roast potatoes:
Toss the potatoes in the mixture of the oil, salt and pepper and place them in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake in a 400F/200C oven until golden brown and crispy on both sides, about 35 minutes in total, flipping halfway through.
For the dressing:
Mix everything well.
Toss the dressing and potatoes while they are still warm from the oven, let the cheese melt and enjoy while warm!

name: Miso Chili Oil
description: A tasty chili oil with crispy chili flakes, miso paste and sesame seeds!
ingredients: 1 cup neutral oil (such as grapeseed oil, sunflower oil or vegetable oil)
instructions: Heat the oil in a small saucepan until it reaches 325F/170C.
Place the gochugaru and red pepper flakes in a heat safe bowl and pour the oil over it.
When the red pepper flakes stop sizzling, mix in the sesame seeds and garlic.
When the mixture cools down to room temperature, mix in the soy sauce, miso paste and sesame oil.
Store in a sealed container in the fridge, mix before using.

name: Chocolate Cracker Toffee
description: Crispy toffee coated crackers topped with chocolate!
ingredients: 4 ounces crackers (saltine, graham, ritz, etc.) (gluten-free for gluten-free)
2 cups (10 to 12 ounces) semi-sweet chocolate, chips or chopped
instructions: Place the crackers in a single layer on the bottom of a baking pan.
Place the butter and brown sugar in a large saucepan, bring to a roiling boil and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour the mixture on the crackers and gently spread it out evenly over them.
Bake in a preheated 400F/200C oven until the caramel is bubbling all over, about 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven, sprinkle the chocolate on immediately, wait until the chocolate turns a dark glossy colour, about 30 seconds, and gently spread the chocolate over the top.
Sprinkle any toppings on while the chocolate is still wet before letting it cool completely.
When everything is set, break into pieces and enjoy.

name: Shepherd’s Pie Soup
description: All of the flavours of shepherd's pie is soup form with the mashed potatoes mixed in, making for a thick and creamy broth!
ingredients: 1 cup aged white cheddar cheese, shredded (optional)
instructions: Place the potatoes in a pot, cover in water, bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 15-20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the beef, onions and carrots in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, breaking the beef apart as it cooks, until the beef is cooked through, and drain off any excess grease.
Add the garlic and tomato paste to the beef and cook until fragrant, about a minute.

Add half of the broth, the remaining potatoes, the Worcestershire sauce, rosemary, thyme and bay leaves to the beef, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 15-20 minutes.
Meanwhile, when the potatoes from step 1 are cooked, drain them and puree them, along with the sour cream and butter and the remaining broth before mixing into the soup.
When the diced potatoes in the soup are tender, add the cheddar and let it melt into the soup, about 2 minutes.
Add the peas and heat, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!

name: Turkey and Wild Rice Soup
description: A hearty and tasty turkey soup with mushrooms, wild rice and cream! The perfect cool weather comfort food!
ingredients: 2 cups cooked turkey, cut into small pieces
instructions: Melt the butter in a large saucepan, add the onion, carrots, celery and mushrooms and cook until tender, about 7-10 minutes.
Add the garlic, rosemary and thyme and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Sprinkle in the flour and cook, while mixing, for 2 minutes.
Add the stock, turkey, wild rice and poultry seasoning, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until the rice is cooked, about 40 minutes. *
Add the parmesan and cream and cook until the cheese has melted, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt pepper to baste before mixing in the parsley and enjoying!

name: Easy Homemade Turkey Stock
description: A super easy to make turkey stock that's perfect for soups, stews, etc. and it’s just packed with flavour!
ingredients: 1 turkey carcasses, bones and leftover meat, skin, etc.
instructions: Place everything in a large stock pot, cover with 4 inches of water, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer for 2 hours.
Strain the solids from the stock and discard them.
Optionally, let the stock cool in the fridge overnight and skim off any fat before using.

name: Five Cheese Garlic Spaghetti Squash
description: Spaghetti squash filled with 5 kinds of cheese, cream, spinach and plenty of garlic!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon thyme, chopped (or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme)
2 medium spaghetti squash, halved and seeds removed
instructions: Mix the mozzarella, fontina, and provolone and divide in half.
Mix half of the shredded cheese mixture with the parmesan, ricotta, cream, spinach, garlic, and thyme before seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.

Divide the cheese and spinach mixture between the spaghetti squash, placing it in the hollowed out centers where the seeds used to be, before sprinkling on the remaining mixture of the shredded cheeses.
Roast in a preheated 400F/200C oven until the spaghetti squash is tender, the cheese has melted and is bubbling, about 30-40 minutes.
Either serve as is in the shells, or shred the spaghetti squash into ‘noodles’, mixing it in with all of the melted cheese and serve in the shells or in a bowl.

name: Broccoli Cheddar Rice
description: A quick and easy rice side dish with broccoli and plenty of cheese!
ingredients: 2 cups chicken broth (or vegetable broth or water)
2 cups broccoli, cut into small pieces
instructions: Heat the butter in a saucepan over medium heat, add the onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the rice, mix and cook until the rice starts to turn translucent, about 1-3 minutes.
Add the broth, bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low and cook, covered, for 15 minutes.
Add the butter and broccoli, cover and cook for another 5 minutes, before turning off the heat.
Mix in the cheese and let it melt before seasoning with salt and pepper to taste and enjoying!

name: Feta and Roasted Red Pepper Dip (Htipiti)
description: Htipiti (Greek Roasted Red Pepper and Feta Cheese Dip) Recipe : A Greek style roasted red pepper and feta dip with extra kick from a roasted jalapeno pepper and a flavour boost from sun-dried tomatoes!
instructions: Puree everything in a food processor.

name: Creamy Chicken Romano
description: Pan seared chicken in a light and creamy sauce with plenty of romano cheese!
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breasts (boneless and skinless), pounded thin or butterflied
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan over medium-high heat, add the chicken and cook until lightly golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side, before setting aside.
Add the garlic and saute until fragrant, about a minute.
Add half of the broth, and deglaze the pan by scraping any brown bits up off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon as the broth sizzles.
Add the remaining broth and the cream, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the sauce thickens a bit, about 3-5 minutes.
Add the cheese and simmer until it melts, about a minute.
Add the chicken, along with any juices, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste, before mixing in the parsley and enjoying!

name: Pork Ragu
description: A tasty slow simmered, melt in your mouth pork ragu!
ingredients: 3 pound pork shoulder/butt, trimmed and cut into 2-3 inch cubes
1 cup granny smith apple, peeled, cored and diced (optional)
1 sprig thyme (or 1 teaspoon fresh chopped or ½ teaspoon dried)
1 sprig rosemary (or 1 teaspoon fresh chopped or ½ teaspoon dried)
1 sprig sage (or 1 teaspoon fresh chopped or ½ teaspoon dried)
instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the pork, seasoned with salt and pepper to taste, and brown on all sides, before setting aside.
Add the onions, carrots, celery and apple and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic, fennel and tomato paste and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add 1/2 cup of the broth and deglaze the pan by scraping any brown bits off the bottom of the pan with a spoon while the broth simmers.

Add the remaining broth, crushed tomatoes, thyme, rosemary, sage, and bay leaves, bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, until the beef is falling apart tender, about 2-3 hours. (You can also transfer the pot to the oven preheated to 275F/140C and cook until falling apart tender, about 3-4 hours.)
Remove the pork, shred and return to the sauce.
Remove the sprigs of herbs and bay leaves.
Add the cream and parmesan and cook until the parmesan has melted, about a minute.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!

name: Chicken Parmesan
description: The classic, and amazing chicken parmesan; chicken coated in parmesan and crispy fried bread crumbs and smothered in melted mozzarella and tasty marinara sauce!
ingredients: 1 cup breadcrumbs (gluten-free for gluten-free) (I like panko)
1 pound chicken breasts (boneless and skinless), pounded thin or butterflied
instructions: Mix the eggs, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper in a wide bowl.
Mix the breadcrumbs and parmesan in another bowl.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Lightly dust the chicken in the flour, shaking off any excess.
Dip the chicken in the egg mixture, shaking off any excess.
Press the chicken into the breadcrumbs to coat on all sides and shake off any excess.
Cook the chicken in the oil in the pan until golden brown on both sides and place on a baking pan.
Sprinkle on the mozzarella and bake in a preheated 350F/180C oven until the cheese has melted, about 5-10 minutes.
Heat the marinara sauce and serve the chicken with the sauce!

name: Chicken and Rice Soup with Crispy Garlic Butter
description: A tasty chicken and rice soup served with crispy fried garlic and garlic browned butter!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken thighs (or breasts)
instructions: Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat, add the garlic and cook until the garlic is crispy and golden brown and the butter is lightly browned before setting the garlic and all but 1 tablespoon of the butter aside.
Add the onion to the pan and cook in the remaining butter until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the thyme and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the broth, chicken and rice, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the rice is tender and the chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Remove the chicken and shred or dice before returning it to the soup.
Add the spinach and parmesan and cook until the spinach has wilted and the cheese has melted into the soup, about 2-3 minutes
Add the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve garnished with green onions, and the crispy fried garlic and browned butter along with extra parmesan if desired.

name: Pumpkin Alfredo Pasta
description: A quick, easy and tasty pumpkin pasta sauce with all of the flavours of fall!
ingredients: 1 cup low-sodium chicken broth (or vegetable broth)
instructions: Start cooking the pasta as directed.
Melt the butter in a large pan over medium heat, add the onion and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the broth, pumpkin puree, nutmeg and cinnamon and bring to a boil before reducing the heat.
Add the cream, cheese and sage and let the cheese melt into the sauce before seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss pasta and sauce and enjoy!

name: Melitzanosalata (Greek Eggplant Dip)
description: A simple and tasty roasted eggplant dip with pungent onion and garlic, bright lemon and parsley and mellow extra virgin olive oil for creaminess!
ingredients: extra virgin olive oil to taste
instructions: Prick the eggplants a few times with a fork, place on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 400F/200C oven until really tender, about 30-40 minutes.
Cut the eggplants open, scoop out the flesh and mash with a fork or puree in a food processor.
Mix the eggplant, onion, garlic, lemon juice and parsley along with enough olive oil to get it to the desired texture and consistency.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and either enjoy immediately or let it sit in the fridge for a while to let the flavours mingle.

name: Italian Sausage Butternut Squash Soup
description: A hearty fall soup with butternut squash and Italian sausage.
ingredients: 1 (14.5 ounce) can white beans, drained and rinsed
1 medium butternut squash (~2-3 pounds), peeled and cubed
instructions: Cook the sausage in a large saucepan over medium heat until cooked through, breaking it apart as it cooks, before setting aside and draining all but 1 tablespoon of grease from the pan.
Add the onion and bell pepper and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the chicken broth, white beans, tomatoes and butternut squash, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the squash is just tender, about 10-15 minutes.
Puree half of the soup with a stick/hand blender or in a food processor or blender.
Add the sausage and parmesan and cook until the cheese has melted before seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Pumpkin Risotto
description: A warming bowl of creamy pumpkin risotto! The perfect comfort food for fall!
ingredients: 5 cups chicken stock (or vegetable broth, warm)
instructions: Melt the butter in a sauce pan over medium heat, add the onion and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the rice and cook until it starts to turn translucent, about 1-3 minutes.
Add the wine, deglaze the bottom of the pan by scraping up any brown bits off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon while the wine sizzles.
Add 1/2 cup of broth and cook, stirring constantly until it has been absorbed into the rice before repeating, 1/2 cup at a time, until all of the broth has been added and absorbed.
Add the pumpkin puree and mix well.
Add the nutmeg, sage, butter and parmesan, mix it in and cook until the butter and cheese has melted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!

name: Fondant Potatoes
description: Large cylinders of potatoes, crispy on the outside and melt in your mouth creamy on the inside, in a butter and garlic broth with aromatic herbs.
ingredients: 4 large russet potatoes, peeled and sliced into 1-1.5 inch thick cylinders
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium-low heat, add the potatoes and cook until golden brown, about 8-10 minutes, flip and cook the other side.
Add the butter and let it melt before adding the garlic, rosemary and thyme.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before carefully adding the broth.
Cover and simmer gently until tender, about 25-30 minutes.

name: Grilled Mojo ChickenMojo Sauce
description: Quick and easy grilled chicken with the fresh, citrusy and garlic flavours of mojo sauce!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs
instructions: Marinate the chicken in half of the mojo sauce for 20 minutes to overnight.
Shake off any excess marinade from the chicken and grill over medium-high heat until cooked through and lightly charred on both sides, about 2-8 minutes per side.
Enjoy with the remaining mojo sauce!
Puree everything in a food processor and enjoy or store in the fridge for use within a few days.

name: Roast Chicken Shawarma Gyros
description: Homemade chicken shawarma, oven roasted on a vertical spit, served in gyros!
ingredients: 4 pounds boneless and skinless chicken thighs, trimmed and pounded thin
instructions: For the chicken shawarma:
Mix the olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, garlic, salt, pepper, paprika, red pepper flakes, oregano, coriander, cumin.
Mix the seasoning into the chicken and optionally let marinate in the fridge overnight.
Place the half onion on top of a large baking dish with the cut side down, place a skewer* into the top and start layering the chicken on, alternating as you layer it.
Roast in a preheated 375F/190C oven until the center reaches 165F, about 1-1.5 hours, let cook and slice.
For the gyros:
Assemble the gyros and enjoy!

name: Corn and Jalapeno Chowder
description: A creamy chowder with corn, jalapenos and potatoes!
ingredients: 2 large Russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the onion and jalapeno and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the garlic, cumin, paprika, and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Sprinkle in the flour and cook, stirring, until the flour starts to turn a light golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Add the broth and potatoes, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the corn and jalapeno and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the cream and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove from heat, mix in the cilantro and enjoy!

name: Turmeric Zucchini Soup
description: A light and tasty zucchini soup with lemon, turmeric, cayenne and ginger.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large sauce over medium-high heat, add the onion, carrot and celery and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne and cook, mixing, until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the broth, coconut milk and zucchini, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the zucchini is tender, about 10 minutes.
Optionally puree some or all of the soup with a stick blender, in a food processor or a blender and return to the pan.
Add the fish sauce and lemon juice before seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
Mix in the cilantro and enjoy!

name: Zucchini Alfredo Sauce
description: A fresh and summery alfredo sauce with parmesan, pureed zucchini, lemon and basil!
ingredients: 1/2 cup heavy cream (or milk or broth)
instructions: Melt the butter in a large pan over medium heat, add the zucchini and onion and cook until tender, about 5-8 minutes.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Transfer to a food processor or a blender, add the cream and puree before returning to the pan.
Melt the cheese into the sauce.
Add the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove from heat and mix in the basil.

name: Chicken Margherita
description: Grilled chicken topped with basil pesto (green), mozzarella (white) and tomato (red), inspired by the flavours of Margherita pizza!
instructions: Marinate the chicken in the balsamic vinaigrette along with the italian seasoning for 30 minutes to overnight.

Grill (or pan sear) the chicken over medium-high heat until cooked through and slightly charred, about 2-4 minutes per side, before topping with the mozzarella and letting it heat until it just starts to melt.
Serve topped with the basil pesto, diced tomatoes, and fresh sliced basil!

name: Mexican Street Corn Baked Chicken
description: One-pan baked chicken covered in corn with all of the flavours of Mexican street corn!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts (or thighs)
salt, pepper and chili powder (or cayenne) to taste
instructions: Place the chicken in a large baking dish, such as an 8×12 pan, and sprinkle on tha taco seasoning.
Mix the corn, mayonnaise, sour cream, lime juice, salt, pepper and chili powder and pour over the chicken in the pan before topping with cheese.
Bake in a preheated 350F/180C oven until the chicken is cooked through, about 25-35 minutes, before sprinkling on the cilantro and enjoying!

name: Dill Pickle Chicken Salad
description: A creamy chicken salad with plenty of dill pickles!
ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken, shredded or diced
1 tablespoon dill, chopped (or 1 teaspoon dried dill)
instructions: Mix the chicken, dill pickle, celery, red onion, green onion, and dill.
Mix the mayonnaise, sour cream, pickle juice, dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Toss the salad and the dressing until coated and either enjoy right away or chill in the fridge for an hour to overnight

name: Korean BBQ Burgers
description: Burgers in Korean style BBQ sauce with kimchi mayo! Having just shared recipes for kimchi mayo and Korean BBQ sauce I am using them both in a recipe! Korean BBQ burgers with kimchi mayo! I
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef (or pork or chicken)
1/3 cup panko bread crumbs (or breadcrumbs) (gluten-free for gluten-free)
instructions: Mix the beef, Korean BBQ sauce, egg, breadcrumbs, and green onions, form the mixture into 4 patties and grill, or pan-fry, or broil over medium-high heat until cooked, about 3-5 minutes per side.
Baste the patties with the Korean BBQ sauce, assemble the burgers and enjoy!

name: Kimchi Mayo
description: A tasty and spicy mayonnaise sauce with chopped chunks of kimchi!
instructions: Mix everything and enjoy!

name: Korean BBQ Sauce
description: A simple and tasty homemade Korean style BBQ sauce!
instructions: Bring the soy sauce, brown sugar, honey, mirin, pear, onion, garlic, ginger, green onion, rice vinegar, gochujang, pepper, and cornstarch to simmer and cook until the sugar has dissolved into the sauce and the sauce has thickened a bit, about 5 minutes, before straining the solids out and letting it cool.

name: Dry Rub
description: A simple dry rub that's sweet, spicy and all kinds of tasty, perfect for chicken, beef and pork!
ingredients: 2 tablespoons paprika (I like to use smoked paprika)
1 tablespoon chili powder (I like use chipotle chili powder)
instructions: Mix everything well.

name: Coleslaw
description: A tasty homemade coleslaw that's so easy to make!
ingredients: 8 cups green cabbage, shredded of finely chopped
1 cup carrot, shredded of finely chopped
instructions: Mix the cabbage, carrot and onion.
Mix the mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt and pepper until the sugar has dissolved into the dressing.
Mix the coleslaw salad and dressing and either enjoy immediately or, better yet, let it sit in the fridge for an hour to overnight to let the flavours mingle!

name: Mustard BBQ Sauce
description: An easy to make and tasty sweet, tangy and spicy mustard BBQ sauce!
instructions: Mix everything until the sugar has melted into the sauce.

name: Zucchini Tots
description: Quick easy and tasty cheddar zucchini tots, aka baked zucchini fritters!
ingredients: 2 cups zucchini, shredded and squeezed to drain excess liquid (about 2 small zucchini)
instructions: Mix everything, form into 2 tablespoon tots, balls, discs, etc, and place on a greased baking pan.
Bake in a preheated 425F/220C oven until golden brown, about 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through.

name: Chicken Taco Tortilla Roll Ups
description: A creamy chicken salad/dip rolled up in tortillas and sliced into two bite appetizers!
ingredients: 2 cups chicken, cooked and shredded or diced
instructions: Mix the chicken, cheese, taco seasoning, cream cheese, sour cream, green onions, and cilantro.
Spread the chicken taco mixture over the tortillas, roll them up and slice into 1 inch pieces.

name: Mediterranean Orzo Pasta Salad
description: A tasty Mediterreanean style orzo (pasta) and baby spinach salad.
ingredients: 8 ounces orzo (gluten free for gluten free)
1 cup chickpeas (cooked or rinsed and drained)
instructions: Cook the orzo as directed on the package, drain and rinse in cold water until the orzo has cooled.
Place the orzo, spinach, chickpeas, tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, kalamata olives, green olives and feta in a large bowl.
Mix the olive oil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, parsley, oregano, garlic, salt and pepper.
Toss the salad and dressing and enjoy!

name: Steak and Egg Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing
description: A steak and egg themed salad with asparagus bacon and a tasty blue cheese dressing!
ingredients: 1 pound steak (T-bone, ribeye, striploin, flank, etc.)
4 ounces bacon, cut into 1 inch pieces
2 hard boiled eggs, peeled and sliced
instructions: Season the steak with salt and pepper to taste and grill over medium-high heat until cooked to the desired level of doneness, about 3-5 minutes per side, before setting aside to rest for 5 minutes.
Grill the asparagus until tender and lightly charred.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon until crispy.
Slice the steak and asparagus into bite size pieces.
Assemble the salad, toss and enjoy!

name: Jalapeno Honey Lime Corn Salad with Avocado
description: A summer grilled corn salad with jalapeno and avocado in a honey lime dressing!
ingredients: 3 cups corn (about 4 ears), cut from the cob
1/2 jalapeno, thinly sliced or finely diced
instructions: Melt the butter in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat, add the corn, toss and let it sit cooking until charred, mix it up and let it char again, about 6-10 minutes.
Add the jalapeno, saute for a minute and remove from heat.
Mix everything and enjoy!

name: Shish Tawook
description: Aka Shish Taouk, is a Middle Eastern marinated, skewered and grilled chicken that's easy to make and tasty!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: Mix the yogurt, oil, lemon juice, tomato paste, garlic, paprika, ground cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Mix the chicken into the marinade and marinate, covered, in the fridge for 20 minutes to overnight.
Skewer the chicken and grill over medium-high heat until cooked through and slightly charred, about 2-5 minutes per side.

name: Sumac Onions
description: Quick and easy pickled onions with sumac!
instructions: Mix the lemon juice, red wine vinegar, salt and sugar until the salt and sugar have dissolved.
Mix everything and let sit, covered, for 1 hour to overnight in the fridge.

name: Bacon Pimento Cheese Potato Salad
description: A potato salad with pimento pepper, cheddar cheese and bacon in a creamy dressing!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon buffalo hot sauce (or to taste)
1 (7 ounce) jar pimentos, chopped and drained
instructions: Place the potatoes in a large pot, cover with water, add a pinch of salt, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are just tender, about 8-10 minutes, before removing from water and letting them cool.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon and crumble.
Mix the mayonnaise, sour cream, vinegar, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper.
Mix the potatoes, bacon, pimentos, cheese, onions and green onions, toss with the dressing and either enjoy right away or chill in the fridge overnight.

name: Greek MeatballsGreek Meatball Salad
description: Meatballs with Greek style flavours including feta, oregano, parsley, mint and dill!
instructions: Mix everything well, form into 2 tablespoon balls, place on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 400F/200C oven until cooked and lightly golden brown, about 25-30 minutes.
Assemble salad as desired and enjoy!

name: Grilled Chermoula Chicken
description: A quick and easy grilled chicken marinated in a tasty chermoula sauce!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs
instructions: Marinate the chicken in half of the chermoula sauce for 20 minutes to overnight.
Shake off any excess marinade from the chicken and grill over medium-high heat until cooked through and lightly charred on both sides, about 2-8 minutes per side.
Enjoy with the remaining chermoula sauce!

name: Chermoula Sauce
description: A North African style green sauce with cilantro, parsley, mint, garlic, lemon juice and olive oil.
instructions: Puree everything in a food processor until smooth.

name: Buffalo Chicken Salad Quesadillas
description: Buffalo chicken salad sandwiched between toasted tortillas along with plenty of melted cheese!
ingredients: 2 (10 inch) tortillas (corn tortillas for gluten free)
instructions: Heat a pan over medium heat, place one tortilla in the pan, sprinkle half of the cheese followed by the buffalo chicken salad, the remaining cheese and remaining tortilla.
Cook until the quesadilla is golden brown on both sides and the cheese is melted, about 2-4 minutes per side.

name: Buffalo Chicken SaladBuffalo Chicken Salad Wraps
description: A chicken salad with all of the flavours of buffalo wings!
ingredients: 4 cups chicken, cooked and shredded or sliced
1 (12 inch) tortilla (corn tortillas for gluten free)
instructions: Mix the buffalo hot sauce, cream cheese, and mayonnaise before seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
Mix the buffalo dressing, chicken, bacon, carrot, celery, green onion, blue cheese, and cheddar cheese.
Assemble the wrap and enjoy!

name: Blue Cheese and Bacon Potato Salad
description: A quick and easy blue cheese potato salad with bacon that's equally as good, warm or chilled!
instructions: Place the potatoes in a large pot, cover with water, add a pinch of salt, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are just tender, about 8-10 minutes, before removing from water and letting them cool.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon and crumble.
Mix everything and enjoy or let sit, covered, in the fridge for an hour or overnight!

name: Honey Chipotle Grilled Chicken Skewers
description: Chicken marinated in a tasty honey and chipotle sauce, skewered up and grilled to perfection!
ingredients: 1/4 cup chipotle chilies and adobo sauce (from a can)
2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar (or lime juice)
1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: Puree the honey, chipotle chilies and adobo sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic and cumin in a food processor.
Marinate the chicken in half of the honey chipotle sauce for 20 minutes to overnight.
Skewer the chicken and grill over medium-high heat until slightly charred and cooked, about 2-5 minutes per side.
Serve with the remaining honey chipotle sauce for dipping!

name: Blue Cheese Dressing
description: Blue Cheese Dressing Recipe : A creamy and tangy homemade blue cheese dressing!
instructions: Mix everything well and enjoy, optionally after chilling in the fridge for a while to let the flavours mingle and come out!

name: Carne Asada Tacos with Avocado Salsa Verde
description: Thinly sliced grilled carne asada in tortillas with onion, cilantro, and creamy avocado salsa!
ingredients: 1 pound carne asada, cooked and thinly sliced
instructions: Assemble the tacos and enjoy

name: Carne Asada with Avocado Salsa Verde
description: Steak marinated in a tasty Mexican mojo sauce and then grilled to perfection before being sliced thinly and served with avocado salsa verde.
instructions: Marinate the steak in the mixture of the oil, orange juice, lime juice, garlic, jalapeno, cilantro, cumin, oregano, salt and pepper overnight.

Grill over medium-high heat until cooked to the desired level of doneness, about 2-5 minutes per side, before removing from heat, letting it rest for 5 minutes and slicing it thinly, against the grain.

name: Avocado Salsa Verde
description: A chunky avocado salsa verde, with a roasted tomatillo, jalapenos and lime juice!
instructions: Roast the tomatillos, jalapenos, onion chunks either over open flame, or in a heavy bottom pan over high heat or under the broiler, until slightly blackened or charred on all sides.
Puree the tomatillos, jalapenos, onion, garlic, lime juice, cilantro in a food processor and season with salt to taste.
Mix the mashed avocado into the salsa verde and enjoy!

name: Hawaiian Pasta Salad
description: A Hawaiian inspired pasta salad with ham and pineapple in a sweet, tangy and creamy dressing!
instructions: Cook the pasta as directed on the package, drain and rinse in cold water until the pasta has cooled.
Mix the pasta, pineapple, ham, bell pepper, carrot, red and green onions.
Mix the mayo, pineapple juice, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper.
Mix the dressing into the salad and enjoy!

name: Huli Huli Grilled Chicken
description: Grilled chicken in a tasty Hawaiian themed huli huli sauce served in buns along with grilled pineapple slices!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs
instructions: For the huli huli sauce:
Mix everything until the sugar dissolves into the liquid.
For the grilled chicken:
Marinate the chicken in the half of the huli huli sauce for 30 minutes to 2 hours.

Shake off any excess marinade from the chicken and grill over medium-high heat until cooked through and lightly charred on both sides, about 2-8 minutes per side, basting with some of the remaining huli huli sauce as it cooks.
For the sandwiches:
Assemble the sandwiches and enjoy!

name: Warm German Potato Salad
description: A potato salad in a tangy vinegar and mustard sauce with bacon that's best enjoyed while warm!
instructions: Cover the potatoes in water in a large pot, bring to a boil and cook until just tender, about 10 minutes, before draining.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large pan and set aside, reserving 2 tablespoon bacon grease in the pan.
Add the onion to the pan and cook in the bacon grease until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the vinegar, mustards, and sugar mix well and season with salt and pepper to taste, before turning off the heat.
Add the potatoes, bacon, and parsley, toss to coat and enjoy while warm!

name: Asparagus Bacon and Egg Salad
description: An asparagus, bacon and egg salad in a creamy lemon dijon dressing with chives!
ingredients: 3 hard boiled eggs, peeled and diced
instructions: Bring some water to boil in a wide pan, add the asparagus and simmer until they just turn a bright green, before transferring to a bowl filled with cold water to cool.
Mix the mayo, mustard, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Optionally slice the asparagus into bite sized pieces and toss with the diced eggs, crumbled bacon and chives.

name: Hawaiian Meatballs
description: Meatballs in a sweet, spicy, salty and tangy pineapple sauce!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon soy sauce (gluten-free or tamari for gluten-free)
1 (14 ounce) can pineapple chunks (pineapple and juice)
1/4 cup soy sauce (gluten-free or tamari for gluten-free)
instructions: For the meatballs:
Mix everything well, form into 2 tablespoon balls, place on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 400F/200C oven until cooked and lightly golden brown, about 25-30 minutes.
Toss in the sauce and enjoy!
For the sauce:
Mix everything well, bring to a simmer in a pan until the sauce thickens a bit, about 3-5 minutes.

name: 20 Minute Vietnamese Caramel Beef
description: A quick and easy Vietnamese style beef dish with a sweet, spicy, salty and sour caramelized sauce!
instructions: Melt the sugar into the water in a large pan over medium heat, bring to a boil and let it cook until it turns a nice caramelized brown/amber colour, about 2-3 minutes.
Add beef and shallot and cook, breaking the beef apart as it cooks, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic, galangal, chili, fish sauce, lime zest and juice, mix and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Mix in the fresh herbs and enjoy!

name: Asparagus Stuffed Chicken
description: Chicken stuffed with asparagus, sundried tomatoes and plenty of melted cheese!
ingredients: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, butterflied
instructions: Lay the butterflied chicken down with the cut side up, sprinkle on the cheese, and sundried tomatoes, along with the asparagus before folding one side back over and sealing it up with toothpicks.
Season the outside of the chicken with the combination of the paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, oregano, salt and pepper.
Heat the oil in a large oven safe skillet over medium heat, add the chicken and lightly brown on both sides, gently flipping in between, about 2-3 minutes per side.

Either: Transfer to a preheated 350F/180C oven and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10-25 minutes, OR cover the pan with a lid, reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.

name: Lemon Chicken Romano
description: A quick and easy chicken coated in a crispy golden brown breadcrumbs with lemon and romano cheese!
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breasts (boneless and skinless), pounded thin or butterflied
instructions: Mix the eggs, oregano, lemon zest, salt and pepper in a wide bowl.
Mix the breadcrumbs and romano in another bowl.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Lightly dust the chicken in the flour, shaking off any excess.
Dip the chicken in the egg mixture, shaking off any excess.
Press the chicken into the breadcrumbs to coat on all sides and shake off any excess.
Cook the chicken in the oil in the pan until golden brown on both sides and place on a baking pan.
Sprinkle on the mozzarella and bake in a preheated 350F/180C oven until the cheese has melted, about 5-10 minutes.

name: Asparagus Soup
description: A quick and easy creamy asparagus soup!
ingredients: 1 pound asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1 inch pieces
1 pound potatoes, cut into 1 inch cubes
instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the broth, asparagus and potatoes, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the asparagus and potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
Add the basil and lemon zest and puree the soup with a hand blender, or in a food processor, or in a blender, until smooth before returning it to the saucepan.
Add the cream, cheese, and miso paste, mix well and let cook until the cheese has melted into the sauce, about 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and enjoy!

name: Creamy Tuscan Mushrooms
description: Whole mushrooms in a creamy parmesan sauce with spinach and sun-dried tomatoes.
instructions: Melt the butter and heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the onions and mushrooms and cook until the onions are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the cream, sun dried tomatoes, parmesan, Italian seasoning, and baby spinach, bring to a simmer and cook until the cheese has melted into the sauce and the spinach has wilted, about 3-5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, garnish with parsley and enjoy!

name: Greek Beef Skillet
description: A quick and easy ground beef skillet dish with Greek style seasonings including spinach, olives, feta, oregano and plenty of fresh herbs!
instructions: Cook the ground beef and onion in a large skillet over medium heat, breaking the beef apart as it cooks, before draining off any excess grease.
Add the garlic, cinnamon and oregano and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the spinach, mix it in and cook until it wilts, about 2-3 minutes.
Mix in the olives and feta before seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
Mix in the green onions, parsley, mint and dill and enjoy!

name: Cajun Chicken Carbonara
description: A quick and easy cajun take on carbonara pasta with cajun seasoned chicken and a lightly cajun seasoned carbonara sauce!
ingredients: 8 ounces pasta (such as linguine or fettuccine or penne, etc.) (gluten-free for gluten-free)
4 ounces bacon cut into 1 inch pieces (or 4 ounces pancetta, diced)
1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts (or thighs)
plenty of fresh cracked black pepper
instructions: Start cooking the pasta as directed on the package.
Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large pan until crispy and set aside.

Season the chicken with the cajun seasoning, and cook in the bacon grease in the pan until golden brown on both sides and cooked through, about 3-5 minutes per side, before setting aside and draining off all but 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease.
Add the garlic and turn off the heat.
Mix the egg, cheese, cajun seasoning, pepper, salt and parsley in a bowl.
Drain the cooked pasta reserving some of the water.
Mix the pasta, the egg mixture and bacon in the pan with the garlic, adding reserved pasta water as needed to form a nice sauce.
Serve topped with the cajun chicken, optionally sliced.

name: Birria de Res con ConsomeBirria Tacos
description: Melt in your mouth tender beef in a rich chili consomé!
ingredients: 3 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into 1 inch cubes
2 cups beef from Birria de Res Con Consome, drained from broth and shredded, warm
2 cups broth from Birria de Res Con Consome, warm
instructions: Lightly toast the chilies in a heavy bottomed skillet for 30 seconds per side before soaking in the just boiled water until tender, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, lightly toast the cumin seeds, coriander seeds, black peppercorns, cloves and cinnamon, in a pan over medium heat until fragrant, before grinding in a spice grinder.
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, add the onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and the spices from step 2 and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the tomato puree, oregano, paprika, allspice and vinegar, bring to a boil and turn off the heat.
Remove the stems and seeds from the soaked chilies and puree them, along with the soaking water and the sauce from the pan, in a food processor until smooth.
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, season the beef with salt and pepper and brown on all sides.
Add the pureed chilli sauce to the pan with the beef along with the bay leaves and broth, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer, covered, until the beef is falling apart tender, about 2 hours.
Working in batches, place the tortillas into a heavy bottom skillet, over medium heat, sprinkle on some cheese followed by beef.
When the cheese has melted gently fold in half and continue to cook until both sides are crispy golden brown!
Enjoy with warm broth from Birria de Res Con Consome on the side for dipping the tacos into!

name: French Onion Baked Chicken
description: Chicken topped with sweet caramelized onions and cheese that's baked until the cheese has melted!
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon thyme, chopped (or 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme)
1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts (or thighs)
instructions: Melt the butter in a pan over medium heat, add the onions and cook until a deep golden brown, about an hour, stirring frequently, adding a bit of water (or broth) to deglaze the pan as needed.
Add the garlic and thyme and cook for another minute while stirring.
Place the chicken in a baking pan, season with salt and pepper to taste, divide the caramelized onions between the chicken, sprinkle on the cheese and pour the broth into the bottom of the pan.
Bake in a preheated 350F/180C oven until the cheese is melted and the chicken is cooked through, about 25-35 minutes.

name: Salsa Verde Chicken Enchilada Skillet
description: A quick and easy deconstructed skillet version of salsa verde chicken enchiladas!
ingredients: 2 cups chicken, cooked and sliced or shredded
instructions: Heat the oil in a large oven safe skillet/pan over medium-high heat, add the onion and zucchini and cook until tender, about 3-5 minutes.
Add the cumin and garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the salsa verde and mix in the sour cream followed by chicken, corn and tortillas.
Bring to a simmer and turn off the heat.
Sprinkle on the cheese and transfer to the oven to broil until the cheese has melted, about a minute.
Garnish with cilantro and enjoy!

name: Philly Cheesesteak Soup
description: A tasty soup with all of the flavours of Philly cheesesteak sandwiches!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Montreal steak seasoning (or salt and pepper to taste)
1/2 cup cheese whiz and/or 4 ounce provolone cheese (deli slices or shredded)
instructions: Cook the beef, onions, peppers and mushrooms in a large saucepan, breaking the beef apart as it cooks, and drain off any excess grease.
Add the garlic and steak seasoning and cook until fragrant, about a minute.
Add the broth, ketchup and Worcestershire sauce, bring to a boil, reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
If using cheese whiz, mix in and enjoy!

If using provolone either mix it into the soup and let it melt OR divide the soup between oven safe bowls, top with the provolone and place under the oven broiler until the cheese has melted, about 1-2 minutes.
